events.title: Capture of Jerusalem during the First Crusade
events.description: Crusaders captured Jerusalem after a difficult siege, establishing the Kingdom of Jerusalem.
events.significance: Marked a pivotal moment in the First Crusade, impacting Christian-Muslim relations for centuries.

events.title: The French National Constituent Assembly adopts the Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen
events.description: The French National Constituent Assembly formally adopted a fundamental document defining individual and collective rights during the French Revolution.
events.significance: Laid the groundwork for modern human rights and democratic principles.

events.title: The Spanish Inquisition is officially disbanded
events.description: The Spanish government abolished the Spanish Inquisition, ending centuries of religious persecution.
events.significance: Signified the decline of religious intolerance and a move toward modernization in Spain.

events.title: Second Battle of the Marne begins
events.description: Allied forces launched a major counteroffensive against German troops in the Second Battle of the Marne during World War I.
events.significance: Marked the turning point leading to the Allied victory in World War I.

events.title: Birth of Amazon under the name Cadabra
events.description: Jeff Bezos founded Amazon initially as Cadabra, intending to revolutionize online retail.
events.significance: Eventually led to the creation of the largest online retailer and significant changes in global commerce.
